algorithm.docs:
KNN (k-Nearest Neighbor) algorithm classifies an instance by selecting K nearest neighbors and choose the label shared by largest numbers of nodes. Click `here <http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/K-nearest_neighbors_algorithm>`_ to get more information.
Note that different to other algorithms, KNN use ``transform`` to predict and does not produce models.
%params% %inputs% %outputs%
Example: >>> labeled = ds.label_field('class') >>> predicted = KNN(k=5).transform(labeled, to_be_predict) >>> predicted.store_odps('predicted')

param.name: k
param.docs: size of nearest neighbors

port.name: train
port.docs: train set with defined features and labels

port.name: predict
port.docs: test set with the same number of features as train set

port.name: output
port.docs: test set with label information stored in ``predict_label`` field

algorithm.docs:
xgboost是一种高效率boosting算法，适用回归和二分类问题，详见 https://github.com/dmlc/xgboost 。 PAI平台目前只开放树形模型（gbtree），暂不开放线性模型（gblinear）。
%params% %inputs% %outputs%

param.name: featureColNames
param.docs: 输入表中用于训练的特征的列名

param.name: labelColName
param.docs: 输入表中标签列的列名

param.name: modelName
param.docs: 输出的模型名

param.name: itemDelimiter
param.docs: item(key value对)之间的分隔符

param.name: kvDelimiter
param.docs: 表中每个item的key和value之间的分隔符

param.name: enableSparse
param.docs: 是否稀疏数据

param.name: eta
param.docs: 为了防止过拟合，更新过程中用到的收缩步长。在每次提升计算之后，算法会直接获得新特征的权重。 eta通过缩减特征的权重使提升计算过程更加保守

param.name: gamma
param.docs: 最小损失衰减

param.name: max_depth
param.docs: 树的最大深度

param.name: min_child_weight
param.docs: 孩子节点中最小的样本权重和。如果一个叶子节点的样本权重和小于min_child_weight则拆分过程结束。在线性回归模型中，这个参数是指建立每个模型所需的最小样本数

param.name: max_delta_step
param.docs: 每个树所允许的最大delta步进

param.name: colsample_bytree
param.docs: 在建立树时对特征采样的比例

param.name: base_score
param.docs: 初始的predict score

param.name: seed
param.docs: 随机数的种子

param.name: objective
param.docs: 定义学习任务及相应的学习目标，可选的目标函数

port.name: input
port.docs: train set with defined features and labels

port.name: output
port.docs: trained model which can be used in prediction

algorithm.docs:
Random forest is a classifier which contains multiple decision trees and its output category depends on the mode of individual tree output categories.
%params% %inputs% %outputs%
Example: >>> labeled = ds.label_field('class') >>> model = RandomForests(tree_num=10).train(labeled) >>> predicted = model.predict(dataset_to_be_predicted) >>> predicted.store_odps('predicted')

param.name: featureColNames
param.docs: input columns. the feature column names selected from input table, which are used for training

param.name: isFeatureContinuous
param.docs: types of feature columns, '1' indicates that features are continuous; '0' means features are discrete. '1,0,0' indicates that the first column is continuous and the second and third column are discrete in three feature columns. The number of values corresponds to the length of features

param.name: labelColName
param.docs: label column.the name of label column selected from input table

param.name: modelName
param.docs: the random forest model

param.name: treeNum
param.docs: the number of trees in forest and the range is (0, 1000]

param.name: weightColName
param.docs: name of weight column in input table. If there is no weight column, then the parameter is None. weightColName>0。

param.name: randomColNum
param.docs: num. of features: the feature number selected randomly when a single tree is generated. The types to be selected include logN, N/3, sqrtN and N. -1 indicates log2N(N refers to the total number of features) and effective value is [1,N]

param.name: minNumObj
param.docs: minimal leaf size, the minimum number is 2

param.name: minNumPer
param.docs: the minimal proportion accounted by leaf node number for parent nodes. -1 indicates no this limitation. The default value is -1 and the range is [0.0,1.0]

param.name: maxTreeDeep
param.docs: maximal depth of tree: -1 indicates completed growth. The range is [1, ∞)

param.name: maxRecordSize
param.docs: maximal num. of instance per tree: the random data number of single tree in forest. The range is (1000, 1000000]. -1 indicates that the record number is 100000

param.name: algorithmType
param.docs: the algorithm types to be selected include: 'id3', 'cart', 'c45' and the default type 'mix', which divides three algorithms mentioned above equally

param.name: randomAttrType
param.docs: the feature number selected randomly when a single tree is generated. The types to be selected include 'logN', 'N/3', 'sqrtN' and 'N'

param.name: minNumPerInt
param.docs: the random data number of single tree in forest. The range is (1000, 1000000]

port.name: input
port.docs: train set with defined features and labels

port.name: output
port.docs: trained model which can be used in prediction

algorithm.docs: 计算随机森林模型中特征重要性。

param.name: labelColName
param.docs: name of label column in input table

port.name: input
port.docs: train set with defined label

port.name: model
port.docs: random forests model

port.name: output
port.docs: trained model which can be used in prediction

algorithm.docs: 计算 GBDT 模型中特征重要性。

param.name: labelColName
param.docs: name of label column in input table

port.name: input
port.docs: train set with defined label

port.name: model
port.docs: random forests model

port.name: output
port.docs: trained model which can be used in prediction

algorithm.docs:
Logistic regression is a classification method utilizing logistic functions. Detailed information can be found `here <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Logistic_regression>`_.
Note that although the original logistic regression algorithm only support binary classification, algorithm implemented in PAI extends it using one-vs-rest strategy. It also use L-BFGS to improve performance.
%params% %inputs% %outputs%
Example: >>> labeled = ds.label_field('class') >>> model = LogisticRegression(max_iter=100).train(labeled) >>> predicted = model.predict(dataset_to_be_predicted) >>> predicted.store_odps('predicted')

param.name: featureColNames
param.docs: names of feature columns, selected from input table and used for training

param.name: labelColName
param.docs: name of label column in input table

param.name: modelName
param.docs: name of output model

param.name: maxIter
param.docs: maximual iterations of L-BFGS. The default value is 100

param.name: epsilon
param.docs: termination condition of L-BFGS, that is the log-likelihood deviation between two interations. The default is 1.0e-06

param.name: regularizedType
param.docs: regularization type. You can select 'l1', 'l2' or None and the default is 'l1'

param.name: goodValue
param.docs: positive label. If you select binary classification, specify the label value of training coefficient. If it is null, system will select a value randomly

param.name: regularizedLevel
param.docs: regularization coeffcient: default value is 1.0; When regularizedType is 'None', this item will be ignored

param.name: twoClassification
param.docs: default is multionmial logistic regression. If this item is checked, it indicates selecting binary classification

port.name: input
port.docs: train set with defined features and labels

port.name: output
port.docs: trained model which can be used in prediction

algorithm.docs:
Support Vector Machine (SVM) is a kind of pattern recognition method based on VC dimension theory and minimal structural risk principle. This version only supports linear binary classification.
%params% %inputs% %outputs%
Example: >>> labeled = ds.label_field('class') >>> model = LinearSVM(epsilon=0.001).train(labeled) >>> predicted = model.predict(dataset_to_be_predicted) >>> predicted.store_odps('predicted')

param.name: labelColName
param.docs: name of label column

param.name: modelName
param.docs: name of output model

param.name: featureColNames
param.docs: names of feature columns selected from input table, used for training

param.name: positiveLabel
param.docs: positive label. If it is not specified, select a random value. When there is an obvious quantity variance between the positive and negative samples, you are supported to specify a value as the positive label

param.name: epsilon
param.docs: convergence coefficient: convergence error, the default value is 0.001 and the range is (0, 1)

param.name: positiveCost
param.docs: positive weight: the default value is 1.0 and its range is (0, ~)

param.name: negativeCost
param.docs: negative weight: the default value is 1.0 and its range is (0, ~)

param.name: cost
param.docs: shortcut for setting both positive cost and negative cost

port.name: input
port.docs: train set with defined features and labels

port.name: output
port.docs: trained model which can be used in prediction

algorithm.docs:
Gradient Boosting Decision Tree is a machine learning technique for regression problems, which produces a prediction model in the form of an ensemble of weak prediction models, typically decision trees. It builds the model in a stage-wise fashion like other boosting methods do, and it generalizes them by allowing optimization of an arbitrary differentiable loss function. This GBDT_LR module is used for binary classification. That is to set a threshold, if the label value is greater than the threshold, it is indicated as a positive example, otherwise it is indicated as a negative example.
%params% %inputs% %outputs%
Example: >>> labeled = ds.label_field('class') >>> model = GBDTLR(tree_count=500).train(labeled) >>> predicted = model.predict(dataset_to_be_predicted) >>> predicted.store_odps('predicted')

param.name: modelName
param.docs: name of modle to be output

param.name: labelColName
param.docs: name of label column selected from input table

param.name: featureColNames
param.docs: feature columns of input table, used for training

param.name: groupIDColName
param.docs: name of grouping column. The default is to take a whole table as a group

param.name: treeCount
param.docs: num. of trees: the range is [1,10000] and default value is 500

param.name: shrinkage
param.docs: leaning rate: the range is (0,1] and default value is 0.05

param.name: maxLeafCount
param.docs: maximal num. of leaves: it must be an integer. The range is [2,1000] and the default value is 32

param.name: maxDepth
param.docs: maximal depth of tree: it must be an integer. The range is [1,11] and the default value is 11

param.name: minLeafSampleCount
param.docs: minimal leaf size: it must be an integer and the range is [100,1000]. The default value is 500

param.name: sampleRatio
param.docs: ratio of instances for training: the range is (0,1] and the default value is 0.6

param.name: featureRatio
param.docs: ratio of features for training: the range is (0,1] and the default value is 0.6

param.name: testRatio
param.docs: ratio of test instances: the range is [0,1) and the default value is 0.0

param.name: randSeed
param.docs: random Seed: it must be an integer and the range is [0,10]. The default value is 0

param.name: featureSplitValueMaxSize
param.docs: maximal splits: the range is [1,1000] and the default value is 500

port.name: input
port.docs: train set with defined features and labels

port.name: output
port.docs: trained model which can be used in prediction

algorithm.docs:
Naive Bayes classifiers are a family of simple probabilistic classifiers based on applying Bayes' theorem with strong (naive) independence assumptions between the features in machine learning. Click `here <http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Naive_Bayes_classifier>`_ for more information.
%params% %inputs% %outputs%
Example: >>> labeled = ds.label_field('class') >>> model = NaiveBayes().train(labeled) >>> predicted = model.predict(dataset_to_be_predicted) >>> predicted.store_odps('predicted')

param.name: featureColNames
param.docs: feature columns in input table, used for training

param.name: labelColName
param.docs: name of label column in input table

param.name: modelName
param.docs: name of generated model

param.name: isFeatureContinuous
param.docs: whether the feature is continuous. 1: continuous; 0: discrete. '1,0,0' indicates that the first column is continuous and the second column and third column are discrete. The value number corresponds to the length of features

port.name: input
port.docs: train set with defined features and labels

port.name: output
port.docs: trained model which can be used in prediction
